actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to assure that an individual or family whose income is increased by reason of a general increase in monthly social security benefits will not, because of such general increase, suffer a loss or reduction in the benefits the individual or family has been receiving under certain Federal or federally assisted programs.

summary.text: Provides that a general increase in social security benefits shall not be taken into account in determining the eligibility of individuals or families to receive benefits under any Federal plan or program or any State plan or program which is funded in whole or in part by Federal funds if the effect of such increase would be to reduce or eliminate the benefits available under such programs.

titles.title: A bill to assure that an individual or family whose income is increased by reason of a general increase in monthly social security benefits will not, because of such general increase, suffer a loss or reduction in the benefits the individual or family has been receiving under certain Federal or federally assisted programs.
